intro: Pentace esquirolii, commonly known as the African starleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a unique and visually appealing species in horticulture.
